meanings.definition: To surpass in brightness or radiance.
meanings.sent1: The sun outglows the moon in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her smile outglows all the stars in the night.
meanings.sent3: The firefly thought it could outglow the streetlamp.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse outglows the city lights, guiding ships safely.
meanings.sent5: The diamond outglows all other gems with its brilliance.

meanings.definition: To shine more brightly than something else.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display outglows the full moon tonight.
meanings.sent2: The new LED light bulb outglows the old incandescent one.
meanings.sent3: The glow-in-the-dark toy outglows the other toys in the dark room.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm outglows everyone else's in the room.
meanings.sent5: The neon sign outglows the rest of the storefronts on the street.
